page.title: 10GRANGE FARM,ROWNER,GOSPORT.
page.content: {Grange Farmhouse}is all that remains of an 1191 acre farm.It is bounded by heathland, the{Wild Grounds an area of mixed woodland and a Naval housing estate. The original part of the farmhouse dates from 1570.It was probably built on the site of the grange belonging to the monks of{Quarr Abbey,}on the Isle of Wight,who were given a grant of land at{Cherc.}It was part of the estate of{Rowner}which was given to the{Brune}family in{1277. The house itself was extended over the years.It was purchased by{Gosport {Council}in 1966, but it was not until 1978-9 that it was renovated.It has been divided into three separate houses,which are occupied by council employees.The{Victorian}farmyard buildings are utilised as workshops and offices.
